column4: since distupgrading to dapper i lost my swedish keyboardsettings. i have no idea where to look as gnome keyboardsettings works fine.
ah. gnomekeys are correct but not working i mean
add "Keyboard indicator" (chances are it'll be named Tastaturindikator), what does it show?
where to add this?
ah found it
right click on panel, "add to panel", find tastaturindikator (assuming that's in swedish)
does it say "Swe" now?
tastatur is german but i found it and it says swe
but you can't type swedish?
aaa, that's what you should've began with
that's always a bitch to debug
sorry. :)
if you make a new user account, does it work there?
have not tried. should i?
yes
still the same.
then, uh, something is fucked and it's always nasty to debug. Honestly, I've never been able to figure that one out, XKB is not exactly an easy piece of software :\
but does it have anything to do with xorg.conf or is it something else?
possibly, try deleting (well, back it up) xorg.conf, then run 'sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg'
or atleast i start editing it manually. :)
that too, but I don't think you know which parts to poke, since I sure as hell don't, not without at least looking at it
i solved it by xmodmap /usr/share/xmodmap/xmodmap.se
that doesn't solve anything, merely works around the problem by loading modmap using old and obsolete method. XKB still doesn't work and it will be broken again on your next login
